This GIS layer was created from the GPS coordinates recorded at the center of each plot to map their distribution and location in the Park.</purpose>       <supplinf>This GIS layer was created from the GPS coordinates recorded at the center of each plot.</supplinf>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>2005</caldate>         </sngdate> Thematic accuracy was not checked for this layer. Thematic data was collected on the ground by trained ecologists.</attraccr>     </attracc>     <logic>All point features were checked for uniqueness and for correct and complete attributing.</logic>     <complete>All field plots collected in 2005 at Washita Battlefield National Historic Site are included in this coverage.</complete>     <posacc>       <horizpa>         <horizpar>GPS accuracy varies for each plot. Portions of the methodology were derived from the USGS/NPS Vegetation Mapping Program's Field Methods for Vegetation Mapping standard. Vegetation data in each sample plot was recorded by qualified ecologists using a standard NVC plot data collection form. Data was manually transferred to a MS Access database. Point coverage was created by importing the database into ArcView as an event theme.</procdesc>         <srcused>None</srcused>         <procdate>Unknown</procdate>         <srcprod>None</srcprod>
